translation.en: It's roped all the way, so I know you can make it.
translation.ko: 로프가 설치돼 있어 다들 올라갈 수 있어요

translation.en: Once we get to the yellow band, we're gonna regroup
put on the masks, turn on the gas.
Yeah, well, he's cornered the market, he's got it.
He reckons there's gonna be 20 teams at Base Camp this season.
I mean, with all the Sherpas and porters, it's gonna be a squeeze up there.
Well, that's a scrum on the ropes, right there.
It's a little decoration for the mess tent.
-You can wear them in your hair. -I'll have that. Thank you.
You stole him from Scott Fischer?
-No, he made up his own mind. -Good job, Rob!
translation.ko: - 스캇 피셔한테서 빼왔어? - 자기 결정이야 잘했어, 롭!

translation.en: How much is he paying you, Rob?
Well, he's only paying for his airfare
but we get 5,000 words in the magazine and our picture on the front cover.
translation.ko: 대신 잡지에 우리 기사와 커버 사진이 실리지

translation.en: That makes it all worthwhile. Right there.
-Well, if you get him to the top. -If?
translation.ko: - 등정에 성공했을 때 얘기지 - 성공했을 때?

translation.en: If? How can you say that to me?
-There you go. You all right? -Thanks, Guy. Cheers, mate.
Yeah, you know, I'm just gonna miss you.
It's just the doing nothing back here that's making me worry.
translation.ko: 난 아무것도 할 수 없다는 게 불안해

translation.en: Just be back for the birth, Rob Hall.
This is a final call for Air New Zealand Flight 7419 to Kathmandu.
-Okay, I love you. -Go, or I'll cry.
Hey, what outfit you guys with?
What are you doing? Writing or climbing or what?
Well, I'll let you know how the summit goes, okay?
translation.ko: 정상에 갔다 와서 다 말해 줄게요

translation.en: What do you do when you're not climbing, Doug?
translation.ko: 등반 안 할 땐 무슨 일 해요?

translation.en: -Seriously, you deliver the mail? -Yeah, I deliver the mail.
translation.ko: - 진짜 우편 배달해요? - 네, 진짜 해요

translation.en: You know he made it to the South Summit on Everest last year?
translation.ko: 저 사람, 작년에 사우스 서밋까지 갔어요

translation.en: That's pretty high for a mailman.
I never made it up to the top of McKinley myself.
-I know. -Well, how do you know that?
You, my friends, are following in some very famous footsteps.
translation.ko: 여러분은 역사의 발자취를 따라가게 될 겁니다

translation.en: A history made famous by George Everest,
George Mallory, Tenzing Norgay, Edmund Hillary.
translation.ko: 조지 말로리, 텐징 노르가이 에드먼드 힐러리죠

translation.en: For those of you who dare face their dreams,
Adventure Consultants offers something beyond the power of words to describe.
translation.ko: 우린 말로 표현할 수 없는 그 뭔가를 드립니다

translation.en: And why don't we describe it in the brochure?
And the odd, if you don't mind, Mike,
To put it simply, guys, human beings simply aren't built to function
at the cruising altitude of a 747.
Okay, once we get above here, above the South Col
our bodies will be literally dying. And I mean literally dying.
It's not called the Death Zone for nothing, guys.
can we get you up to the top and down to the bottom
You might have noticed a bit of the Lone Star State?
I'd like to introduce you to Andy Harris.
Helen and the rest of the team are already on the way up to Base Camp.
They're setting it up for when we get there.
I plan on going for the summit May 10.
It's been a lucky day for me and Adventure Consultants
and the weather's usually pretty stable around then.
we have 40 days to train your bodies and your minds
Now, I know there's a lot of mountaineering experience in this room. You wouldn't be here without it.
translation.ko: 여기 모인 분들은 다 등반 경험이 풍부하죠
- 스튜는 K2, 브로드 피크 정복 - 좋아

translation.en: Six of the Seven Summits and the only woman.
But Everest, though, is another beast, another beast altogether.
That's why you're here, isn't that right, Dougie?
translation.ko: 그래서 여기 오신 거죠 맞지, 더기?

translation.en: So, listen. Tonight, that's it from me. Eat, drink, be merry.
That's it, here we go, Colonel.
Take your seats, buckle in, everyone.
Do or die. Here we go.
-Keep 'em all in a nice group. -Hey, guys, take it easy.
We're kicking it off, let's go.
Guys, man wants to see your climbing permits.
translation.ko: "남체 바자르: 해발 3,750m" 다들 등반 허가증 꺼내세요

translation.en: Need to see all your climbing permits!
Thank you very much, we'll see you on the way back.
Well, you're working three jobs, Doug.
It was the least I could do, mate.
I know, you didn't have to do it, though, and I appreciate it.
translation.ko: 안 그래도 될 텐데… 정말 고마워

translation.en: Let's just get you to the top this time.
Come on, buddy, you can do it.
Thought I was gonna acclimatize faster than this.
Well, I got real close but it got late and I was
Well, I think I would have made a run for it.
Every day I wake up thinking that.
Then why didn't you do it?
Morning 15 at the South Summit, bad conditions, we weren't gonna make our 2:00 p.m. turnaround.
translation.ko: 그 상태론 사우스 서밋에서 2시 하산에 맞출 수 없어서…

translation.en: See, it's all good and well to make the top, Beck
but you pay me to bring you down safely. Remember that.
translation.ko: 내 임무는 안전 하산이라는 거 잊지 마요

translation.en: One of our Sherpas, Tenzing. He had an accident.
Fell while fixing one of the ladders on the Icefall.
It's not good. They had to bring him down.
Congratulations, you all made it. Welcome to Base Camp!
We got the United Nations here this year.
Got the IMAX team, South Africans.
in the best spot of all,
we have the Adventure Consultants Base Camp.
-Good to see you. Thank you. -Welcome, nice to see you.
For those of you that haven't met, this is Helen Wilton, Base Camp manager.
translation.ko: 아직 초면인 분, 여긴 캠프 매니저 헬렌 윌튼이에요

translation.en: She will be your mom for the next few weeks.
translation.ko: 몇 주간 여러분의 모든 문제를 해결해 줄

translation.en: Any problems, take it to her and she'll sort it.
All right, well, it's very nice to finally meet you all in person.
He's your climbing sirdar, your lead Sherpa.
-Bet you climb better than I do. -Yeah.
Summited three times, Beck. All right, all right. I hear ya, I hear ya.
All right, well, there's tea in the mess tent when you've dumped your sacks
translation.ko: 짐 풀고 급식 텐트에서 차 드세요

translation.en: and the comms tent's down the back, that's the cooking tent, and over there
translation.ko: 저긴 통신 텐트, 저긴 취사 텐트, 저긴…

translation.en: It's a little bit drafty, but just remember that
when the wind gets up here, you've got the same view that George Everest did.
translation.ko: 조지 에베레스트가 봤던 풍광을 볼 수 있어요

translation.en: For those of you who haven't used crampons before,
the left and rights are marked with an "L" and an "R," so you can't get it wrong.
First of all, you push it into the shoe with this.
If it isn't the mayor of Base Camp!
Okay. I'm normally a tea man myself, but let's give it a go.
translation.ko: 난 차를 좋아하지만 커피 한잔 마셔보죠

translation.en: I know, man. Some idiot Kiwi goes and invents Himalayan guiding
translation.ko: 웬 뉴질랜드 바보가 등반 가이드 사업을 벌여서

translation.en: Yeah, it didn't take you too long to get in on the act.
You went ahead and fixed the icefalls, I see.
-It's pretty messy up there this year. -Yeah?
Crevasses are pretty big. Strung four or five ladders across.
translation.ko: 크레바스가 넓어져서 사다리를 네댓 개나 연결했소

translation.en: You used good ropes though, didn't you?
You ready? Okay. This is April 7th, about 10:30 a.m.,
this is Sandy Hill Pittman, reporting for NBC Interactive Media
translation.ko: NBC 인터넷 방송 샌디 힐 피트먼입니다

translation.en: and we are officially at Everest Base Camp!
Yeah. Someone went and stole my journalist
so I had to get another one.
She's a lot easier on the eye than Jon Krakauer
-that's for sure. -Listen, just to be clear, I didn't steal your journalist.
Outside magazine gave me a call.
-Said they wanted to-- -It's all good, man.
They were gonna send a journalist up the hill and asked me if I was interested.
It was his call in the end.
All right, Caroline MacKenzie, team doctor. Why don't you kick it off, Caro.
translation.ko: 팀 닥터 캐롤 매킨지예요 인사해요, 캐롤

translation.en: So Rob and Harold and Mike will tell you all sorts of stuff about mountaineering,
translation.ko: 롭과 해롤드, 마이크가 주의 사항을 다 일러주겠지만

translation.en: getting you to the top of Everest is really about oxygen.
To give you the best chance of summiting
you need to prepare your bodies for the thin air up there.
So, over the next month, before the final ascent
translation.ko: 그래서 등반 전 다음 한 달간

translation.en: you're gonna make three partial acclimatizing ascents
returning here to Base Camp after each one.
The bad news is that each ascent begins and ends with the Icefall.
translation.ko: 각 등반은 빙벽에서 시작, 빙벽으로 끝납니다

translation.en: I'm sorry, but there is no way around it.
There are millions of tons of glacial ice continually moving day and night.
translation.ko: 수백만 톤의 빙석이 밤낮 쉬지 않고 움직이고

translation.en: You got seracs the size of tower blocks,
you got crevasses so deep they probably don't even have a bottom.
It is not a place that you wanna get caught hanging out in,
especially when the sun hits it.
So we're gonna be up nice and early and through that as soon as possible.
Now the Sherpas have gone ahead and fixed the ladders across the crevasses
and we've made it as safe as we possibly can.
But that is not to say that it is completely safe.
Nineteen people have died in that Icefall.
Let's look out for each other.
things like slurred speech and irrational behavior.
I've seen hypoxic climbers rip off all their clothes at 8,000 meters
You all know about cerebral edema, the swelling of your brain
to the point of loss of motor function and eventually death.
translation.ko: 운동 기능을 상실하고 최악의 경우엔 죽을 수도 있죠

translation.en: And pulmonary edema, which is your lungs filling with fluid
The only cure is to get down the mountain, fast.
But it is not all doom and gloom here, okay?
Myself and the whole AC team are here to make sure you get up and down safely
So why don't we all give Caro a nice big thank you, it's her first time here.
translation.ko: 캐롤에게 큰 박수! 오늘 처음 올라왔어요

translation.en: See, you want to get on the regulator. You want to hear that hiss.
translation.ko: 산소 조절기 확인해요 쉭쉭 소리 나죠?

translation.en: Can I get a hit of that?
In a situation like this, you just wanna catch your breath, throw it up to four.
translation.ko: 숨을 충분히 쉰 뒤 조절기를 4에 맞추면

translation.en: -You should start feeling pretty good. -I can feel it already.
Well, when we get back to Base, I want you to get Caro to take a look at you.
-No. I'm all right, I'm okay. -No, no.
And do me a favor, spend your night on oxygen.
Just lift your shirt up a bit.
And take a deep breath for me?
Just take one of those in the morning with a bit of water, before breakfast.
-Right, Beck, you're up. -Sorry. Here, go for it.
-You are. -Six days a week in the gym.
-Ought to do it. -Your wife must love that.
I need to send a message to my wife. Can I use your fax?
translation.ko: 집사람한테 메시지 보내게 팩스 좀 씁시다

translation.en: You might wanna look at this one first. It came in for you last night.
Can I use your sat phone?
Well, if this did come in last night, it's an emergency.
I'm at Base Camp right now.
Yeah, it's a satellite phone, honey.
My God, how much is that costing? What's the problem?
translation.ko: 요금 엄청 비싸겠네 무슨 일 있어요?

translation.en: I'm sorry, we were up at Camp Two and that's why I didn't send you a fax yesterday.
translation.ko: 어제 제 2 캠프에 있어서 팩스 못 보냈어

translation.en: doing his homework in the morning, as per usual.
You wanna say hi to him?
Well, yeah, of course I do.
And Meg went on her first date...
Listen, I gotta get the kids to school
Here, come in, mate, come on!
You don't dance, you don't climb!
translation.ko: 춤 못 추면 산도 못 타요!

translation.en: No dance, no climb! No dance, no climb!
translation.ko: 춤 못 추면 산도 못 탄다 춤 못 추면 산도 못 탄다!

translation.en: Hey, man. Breaking into the rations?
No. I'll wait till we summit.
I don't know about that, Neal.
Anyway, me and Anatoli are here to help you, you know?
translation.ko: 나랑 아나톨리가 도와줄 테니 걱정 마

translation.en: We don't need competition between people.
There is competition between every person and this mountain.
translation.ko: 이건 모든 사람들과 이 산의 경쟁이야

translation.en: The last word always belongs to the mountain.
let's get 'em off the face and back down to Base Camp. Turn around.
-Ang Dorjee, come on, we're going down. -Okay.
Keep clenching, just keep the blood flowing.
We're still waiting for the South Africans.
Hey, Ian. You haven't paid for these ladders.
translation.ko: 이안, 당신은 사다리 설치비 안 냈잖아

translation.en: Yeah, yeah. Your Yak Fund money's coming.
-You serious, man? -Come on, get a move on.
How long you been waiting here?
-Hey, Rob, we gotta get 'em over. -We're working on it.
That's it. No, head up, mate, head up.
-Are these ladders gonna take two? -Yeah, I'll get a rope, I'll belay you.
translation.ko: - 두 사람이 지탱될까? - 응, 연결 로프 가져올게

translation.en: -Just stay right where you are, mate. -I can't pull myself up!
I'm gonna come out to you.
-Got it for you. -Right, tie me in, Scott, tie me in.
Right, I'm coming out to you, Beck. Here I come, mate.
Nice and easy, you're tied in, mate.
-I can't feel my hands. -You're looking good.
-Grab me! -Stay right where you are, mate.
-I'm right here, I'm coming to you. -I can't pull myself up!
There's no guarantee to the summit, I get it.
But to get killed because I'm waiting in line like I'm in freaking Walmart.
That's not why I paid you $65,000.
Now get me off of here.
That's it. Plant your feet one at a time.
translation.ko: 좋아요, 한 번에 한 발씩 디뎌요

translation.en: All right, thanks for coming by.
Look, Base Camp's, you know, chockablock full this year, so,
I think it would all benefit us greatly by coming together like this
and, you know, working out some kind of plan and schedule.
What, like some kind of rota?
Everyone knows Everest is a business for you, Robert, are you kidding?
What gives you the right to tell us when we can climb and when we can't?
I'm not telling you, mate. I'm asking.
If we know when everybody's planning to summit, for instance,
we can avoid the chaos that happened in the Icefall today.
translation.ko: 오늘 같은 상황에도 혼란을 피할 수 있죠

translation.en: Adventure Consultants are aiming for May 10.
Okay, that's bumper-to-bumper traffic on the Hillary Step.
Yes, it is, that's my point.
Look, this is ridiculous. We're summiting when we want.
translation.ko: 우린 올라가고 싶을 때 올라갈 거야

translation.en: All right? And I don't need your permission to climb the mountain.
translation.ko: 산에 오르는데 자네 허락이 왜 필요해?

translation.en: Ian, have you seen how many people are here at Base Camp?
-We're finished here. Come on, guys. -Ian! Hey, man.
Have a drink, Rob! Come on, man.
-You feeling a little crook? -No, it's just a little...
Little touch of the Delhi belly.
I told you not to have the Dom Perignon with it!
I don't like the look of the crowds on the ropes.
I think we're gonna have some trouble once we get above Camp Three.
I mean, you wanna top it on the 10th, yeah?
What, are you saying we should team up?
I don't know, man. We have different styles, man.
All due respect, you're a hand-holder. I mean, the best, but...
translation.ko: 고객을 꼼꼼히 챙기는 건 당신 자유지만

translation.en: I just believe that if you can't get up there yourself you shouldn't be on the mountain at all.
translation.ko: 혼자 못 오를 인간은 산에 오질 말아야지

translation.en: You guide your team, I guide mine.
I'm just suggesting that we work with each other instead of against.
The only way we both summit, mate, is if we work together.
translation.ko: 그래야 함께 정상에 오를 수 있어

translation.en: -Yeah? -Yeah, I see the sense in it.
Who's gonna lead when we get up there?
Rob. If I say I will do it, it will be done.
translation.ko: 롭, 내가 한다면 다 할 거야

translation.en: You gotta work with Ang Dorjee, because we're working together now.
translation.ko: 앙 도르지 말 들어 서로 협조하기로 했어

translation.en: I'm just saying, if both of us...
We'll work together and we'll get the job done. Yes?
We're planning on stashing, what, eight bottles of O
-Well, I'm not using O. -What do you mean?
translation.ko: - 난 산소 안 써 - 안 쓰다니?

translation.en: You're not using oxygen at all?
-Come on, man. You know you want to. -English air. Don't need it.
translation.ko: - 써야 돼요 - 영국 공기 안 마셔

translation.en: Yeah, but Anatoli, you're guiding for Scott this year.
You have people's lives in your hands. It's a job.

translation.ko: 난 산소 쓴 적도 쓸 계획도 없어

translation.en: Bigger problems if you run out.
I'll put some more bottles of O up there.
Just so long as you guys are clear.
If you work for me, you use oxygen, otherwise you don't work for me.
You don't have to ask, mate.
I've been up there before without O's, Rob. I don't need to do it with clients.
All right, next we have to fix ropes.
Hillary Step need new fixed rope. And South-East Ridge as well.
translation.ko: 힐러리 스텝과 남동쪽 능선엔 새로 달아야 돼

translation.en: My idea is that we work together and we fix ropes together.
translation.ko: 로프 다는 일도 다 같이 하세

translation.en: All right, you and Lopsang maybe get together. Talk about who wants to fix what and where, okay?
translation.ko: 롭상과 의논해서 로프 손질 같이 해

translation.en: Only essentials. I'm not gonna tell you what to pack, but be brutal. Okay?
translation.ko: 필요한 것만 챙겨요 본인이 알아서 필요한 것만!

translation.en: One pound down here is like 10 up there.
What, and just like that, you kill my summit cappuccino.
All right, it's gonna be a tough week.
But it is gonna be the best Friday of your lives.
translation.ko: 하지만 인생 최고의 금요일이 될 거예요

translation.en: Yeah, what are we doing again on Friday?
-Now it's up to me, right? -Yes it is, yes it is.
I knew it was gonna be a girl. I can't believe it.
I knew I was. -I knew she was. -Congratulations.
Thank you, thank you, Doug. Cheers, mate.
Mid-July, as soon as I get back.
-You better sleep now, buddy. -Yeah, that's true.
-Yeah? -So... Jan doesn't mind you being here?
translation.ko: - 네 - 여기 온 거 잰은 괜찮대요?

translation.en: It's okay. Jan's a climber, Jon, she gets it.
What about you, Doug? What about your wife?
She's been fine with it, ever since we divorced.
She's been great with everything since then.
No, no, no, I ask because Peach said to me,
"If you climb one more mountain, I will divorce you."
And you went ahead and then booked this trip!
No, no, no, the worst part of it
is that I kind of forgot to tell her.
You don't forget to tell her you're climbing Everest! I forgot to tell her, I did.
All right. It's all on the table, here.
It hurts, it's dangerous, it destroys relationships,
it's costing you all a small fortune.
Are there any negative aspects to this game?
I gotta ask the question, you know I do.
That's why. Thank you, Mr. Mallory.
Yasuko. Why are you climbing Everest?
I have reached six of the seven summits, so...
Of course, now I have to reach the seventh.
Yeah, I have kids, but, I thought I told you,
there's an elementary school, back home.
And I've been going and talking to the kids there
and they actually helped me raise some of the money to come
and gave me a flag to plant on the summit, and...
So, I was thinking, maybe it's...
They see a regular guy can,
you know, follow impossible dreams, maybe they'll be inspired
to do the same, I guess.
Because to be able to climb that high
and see that kind of beauty that nobody ever sees,
it'd be a crime not to.
Yeah, yeah, I'm good, I'm better. I'm better now, I'm...
We go for the final ascent tomorrow.
Yeah, I think we're gonna get a good window.
And did you go to the doctor, did you get a scan done?
And? Come on. What did she look like?
You know. Blonde hair, nice smile,
perfect height-to-weight ratio, she's gonna be a great climber.
A little me, a little you.
and our little Sarah, we'll all go climbing together.
Take it easy, now. You're gonna be okay.
We're gonna get you down the hill. All right?
Yeah, Dale, he doesn't look too good.
You can't get Scott on the radio?
Nope. Nah, I think he's up ahead.
Best not to stare too long at the summit.
That's a long way to go, man.
Head down, one step at a time.
translation.ko: 고개 숙이고 한 걸음씩 묵묵히 걸어요

translation.en: Yeah, I did, he wasn't looking too good,
but Neal seemed to have a handle on the situation.
Tried to get you on the radio.
I'm going down to Camp One. If he's not doing so well, I'm gonna take him down to Base Camp
translation.ko: 내려가 보고, 심각하면 베이스 캠프로 후송 후

translation.en: and I'll head back up. You guys all right?
He can't be too far ahead of you, mate.
Yeah, I'll make it down in half the time.
Rob to Guy, you up there, mate?
Yeah, Guy to Rob. I'm here.
There you go, I got the old sly rotter.
Listen, I think you're on the wrong mountain, there.
Look, I can't talk, we gotta get out of here.
All right, mate. Well, listen, you take care on the kiddie slope.
I'm gonna get back to the real thing.
Yeah, don't worry, Rob. I'll keep an eye on you.
Look, I'm telling you, I'm all right.
Don't do that to me again!
I'm gonna drop back with Frank, he's struggling a bit, all right?
Let's get him on the oxygen.
Rob Hall to Scott Fischer, Rob Hall to Scott Fischer,
Mountain Madness, how do you copy?
I've been down to Base Camp, and I'm back at Camp One.
What, you're not gonna rest up a day first? No?
Scott, you sound a little rough.
No way, José, what, miss out on all the fun?
That's a lot of up and down in one day, even for you, Scott.
You know what they say, man.
It's not the altitude, it's the attitude.
Are you sure you're gonna be okay?
Just taking a shot of dexamethasone now.
Well, just don't push yourself too hard, okay? Over and out.
Rob, I've just been over to Mal's to get a weather update.
And it could still go north, but, if it doesn't
translation.ko: 북쪽으로 갈 수도 있지만 아닐 경우

translation.en: it's gonna hit sometime on the 11th, I reckon.
This mountain makes its own weather. We're keeping an eye on it.
Yeah, sure, just letting you know.
Why do we do this to ourselves?
You know, I never told Krakauer this when he was asking us why we climb Everest.
translation.ko: 왜 산에 오르냐는 존 K의 질문엔 대답 안 했지만…

translation.en: It's just like it's a cure.
You know, I'm starting to wonder.
for the rest of your life you'll be a guy that got to the top of Everest.
translation.ko: 평생, 에베레스트를 정복한 사람이 되는 거예요

translation.en: I just hope I get there.
Just hope I get there, and get home.
Little bit of wind, up higher.
I mean, if it picks up, we can always come back down.
I'm hoping it's gonna die down after sundown.
translation.ko: 해 지면 바람이 약해져야 될 텐데…

translation.en: Well, we don't go if it doesn't calm.
I talk to Scott when he comes here.
What's Rob's... What's Rob's team doing?
He wants to see if this passes.
Come out and take a look.
At least somebody up there loves us.
Okay, everyone. We got a window.
We don't know how long it's gonna last, but we're gonna go for it.
translation.ko: 언제 또 폭풍이 불지 모르지만 일단 가보죠

translation.en: Be ready in half an hour.
We'll have a 2:00 p.m. turnaround, let's climb this thing.
Now the South Africans were late out of Camp Three.
They never made it into Camp Four. Probably got caught up in it.
translation.ko: 4 캠프엔 못 왔어 폭풍에 갇혔나 봐

translation.en: Yeah, well, it hit us all night,
but now there's nothing. Absolutely nothing.
translation.ko: 지금은 조용해 바람 한 점 없어

translation.en: So, it's definitely worth a shot.
I'll radio out and tell everyone the news.
Yeah, ring Jan and tell her that we're heading out.
I'll call you, Helen, in 12 hours when we get to the summit.
Good luck, and Godspeed to you all.
I'll see you guys up there. -Take it easy, Scott. -Let's do it.
Gonna get a couple hours of sleep, and I'll be right behind you.
You get some rest, okay? See you there.
You got the ropes for the Hillary Step?
Not a chance we can go faster here. It's too difficult.
translation.ko: 더 빨리는 못 가요 너무 난코스라…

translation.en: I had an operation a couple years ago, on my eyes. That might be it.
translation.ko: 몇 년 전에 눈 수술했는데 그것 때문인가?

translation.en: You guys go in front of us.
All right, Beck, let's sit you down.
I need to send you down with someone.
No, I don't wanna go down, Rob.
-No, you gotta go down. -I don't wanna go down.
You can wait here for half an hour. Beck, listen to me.
If it gets better by then,
join in the queue and keep going up.
But if it doesn't get better, Beck, I'm sorry, mate, it's over.
The Sherpas are gonna go up and drop off the extra oxygen at the South Summit
translation.ko: 셰르파가 사우스 서밋에 여분의 산소를 두고 가면

translation.en: then I'm gonna send one of them down for you. Is that clear?
Sandy, do you want to go down?
Look, Lopsang, I'm gonna make it to the top. Do you understand?
translation.ko: 나 꼭 정상 밟을 거예요 알았죠?

translation.en: There is no rope! No rope.
Yeah, they should have been fixed.
Do you have more in your pack?
Lopsang has the rope. He's not here!
translation.ko: 롭상이 갖고 있는데 걘 여기 없잖아!

translation.en: Listen, we got a problem, here, mate.
There's no fixed ropes on the traverse to the Hillary Step, over.
translation.ko: 힐러리 스텝 쪽 비탈에 로프가 안 묶여있어

translation.en: Yeah, I've got Ang Dorjee here, but there's no sign of Lopsang.
translation.ko: 앙 도르지는 여기 있는데 롭상은 연락이 안 돼

translation.en: So me, Neal, and Toli are gonna have to set some new ones, over.
translation.ko: 나랑 닐, 아나톨리가 새로 로프를 달아야 돼

translation.en: One step at a time, Doug.
Come on, Dougie. Deep breaths, Dougie.
Come on, mate, keep it on, keep it on.
Deep breaths, Dougie, hang on. Hang on.
I don't wanna see you back here a third time, mate.
translation.ko: 세 번씩 다시 올 순 없잖아

translation.en: There's no fixed ropes above the South Summit.
but we're sorting that situation out now.
Ran out of juice, waiting. Cold.
I don't wanna run out of oxygen up there.
Lou, Stuart, and John Taske just turned back.
How are the conditions, so far?
I hope we're not looking at another year with no clients at the top.
translation.ko: 올해는 한 명이라도 정상을 밟아야 할 텐데…

translation.en: Well, if they don't get a move on pretty soon,
they're out of time, aren't they?
And what's Jon gonna say about that in his article?
translation.ko: 존 K가 기사에 쓸 말도 없겠지

translation.en: We just lost Lou, Stu, and John Taske.
What's going on, what's the holdup?
We still have Toli and Neal at the top of the Step
We're at the base of the Step, over.
Doug's just behind me, I left him behind to scoot forward.
Yeah, I got eyes on you right now, yep, that's me. Let's move as...
We'll start moving everybody up, as soon as we get the all clear.
translation.ko: 상황이 안정되는 즉시 다 올려 보낼게

translation.en: Rob to base, Rob to base, how copy, Helen?
-You all right? -Copy, Base Camp to Rob.
Anyone managed to find out where he is, over?
We got a real logjam, here at the Hillary Step, over.
translation.ko: "낮 12시 25분" 힐러리 스텝에서 막혔어 한 시간 이상 지체됐어

translation.en: We're more than an hour behind!
translation.ko: 힐러리 스텝에서 막혔어 한 시간 이상 지체됐어

translation.en: People are just sitting here, using up their oxygen.
Get here as soon as you can.
Yeah, I got a little problem with my eyes.
There's a logjam below the Hillary Step. It's crazy.
translation.ko: 힐러리 스텝 밑에서 꽉 막혀서 꼼짝 못 해요

translation.en: Nah, I can't, promised Rob I'd wait for him.
I'm running pretty low on O.
We've had the all-clear on this end.
I'm gonna stay here with Yasuko, until we get a clear line.
translation.ko: 다 올라간 뒤에 야스코랑 같이 갈게

translation.en: I'll be here till I get a visual on Doug, over and out.
translation.ko: 난 더그가 올 때까지 여기 있을 거야

translation.en: Come here. I'm so proud of you, Yasuko.
Rob to Base, Rob to Base.
Rob, this is Helen, hello? Where are you?
I'm on the top of Everest, Helen, we made it.
We copy you loud and clear, Rob.
It's wonderful to hear your voice up there.
Who are you with, again, say?
At the moment, I'm with Mike and Yasuko.
-Headed down, Rob. -Now you have to go.
Jon K has already been and gone.
Doug is just coming over the horizon.
Beck was having a problem with his eyesight.
He waited on the southeast ridge, on the Balcony
for the first people that came back, over.
And I guess you'll be leaving right away, yes?
We'll be off in a few minutes.
Just as soon as I see Doug, we'll be heading back down, over.
Right, understood. Well, that's terrific, Rob.
We're all keeping our fingers crossed for Doug.
My stomach's not so good, man.
Hey, Roberto. Where are the rest of your guys?
translation.ko: 당신 팀 나머진 다 어디 있어?

translation.en: 'Cause I'm pretty sure my whole team
Don't worry, I won't tell Krakauer.
translation.ko: 걱정 마 존 K에겐 말 안 할게

translation.en: Well done, mate. I had a mixed bag.
I'll have to give you this year.
Scott, you really don't look too good.
Come on, mate, let's get him down.
I'm just trying to sort the O. I can't find any full ones.
translation.ko: 산소통 점검해요 꽉 찬 게 하나도 없네

translation.en: There's full bottles, I saw 'em on the way up.
No, I'm pretty sure you should have another look.
No, I just have, they're not full. Harold, listen, I saw...
Look, mate, I checked twice, all right?
You guys keep going, mate, I'll catch up.
Doug, Doug. Doug, listen to me.
-It's way too late. It's over. -No, come on!
Listen to me, mate, I'm sorry,
but I gotta turn you around.
It's right here, man. It's right here.
I'm not coming back next year, man, it's my last chance.
You gotta let me do this.
There ain't no hope of getting
I'm not seeing too well, Jon. I'm freezing.
translation.ko: 눈이 잘 안 보여, 존 추워죽겠어

translation.en: You'll be okay. Mike's right behind me.
Guy to Rob, you read me, mate?
Guy to Rob, are you there?
Good on you, Doug. Come on.
Come on, let's get you up.
-Need more O. -No, Doug, we can't give you more O.
We gotta get down to the South Summit, come on.
Guy Cotter to Everest Base Camp. You there, Helen?
Guy, this is Helen, how's it going?
I got a clear view of the summit
and we've still got climbers up there. They're not any of ours, right?
translation.ko: 몇 명이 아직 있네 우리 팀 아니지?

translation.en: We got three up, and they're all on their way down.
translation.ko: 남은 세 명 다 하산 중이야

translation.en: Well, what are they doing there so late?
They had a 2:00 turnaround time, they're way past it.
Yeah, we got cloud coming up through the valley, it's a lot of it.
Thanks, I'm calling them now, Guy.
Rob, come in, this is Helen.
Rob, come in, this is Helen.
Easy, easy, easy, Dougie! There you go.
It's Mike, Beck. What are you doing here?
We got a problem with Beck.
Hey, Mike, we're getting low on O. We gotta move.
translation.ko: 마이크, 산소가 부족해 빨리 가야 돼

translation.en: Gonna get you to stand up, okay?
Mike, Harold, Ang Dorjee, put the brakes on, guys, we got a problem.
translation.ko: 마이크, 해롤드, 앙 도르지 멈춰봐, 문제가 생겼다

translation.en: We're out of gas. Need to keep moving, come on.
Mike, Harold, do you copy? I need someone...
I need someone to come back up with oxygen, over.
Doug, come on, mate, come on!
Has anyone got eyes on Ang Dorjee?
Mate, I've just had Ang Dorjee go past me, heading down, over.
translation.ko: 방금 앙 도르지가 날 앞질러서 내려갔어

translation.en: Can you stop him, can you turn him around? I need someone to come back up now.
translation.ko: 좀 불러서 올려 보내줄 수 없나?

translation.en: Base Camp, do you copy, over?
Helen, please. I need a bottle of gas at the top of the Hillary Step.
translation.ko: 힐러리 스텝 꼭대기에 산소 한 통 좀 보내 줘

translation.en: I can't get him down without it.
Understood that you need a bottle of oxygen at the bottom of the Hillary Step.
translation.ko: 힐러리 스텝 밑으로 산소 한 통 갖다 달라는 거지?

translation.en: We are sending it up to you, as soon as we can.
At the top, at the top.
The last thing I said to Ang Dorjee was
"Please, leave two bottles of gas at the South Summit."
translation.ko: 사우스 서밋에 산소 두 통 남겨두라고…

translation.en: there's oxygen at the South Summit, right?
There's no oxygen at South Summit.
Ang Dorjee stashed four bottles there, Harold.
half an hour to get back up to the South Summit.
translation.ko: 사우스 서밋까지 갈 수 있을 거야

translation.en: If you don't have oxygen, mate, don't come up, don't come up.
translation.ko: 산소 없으면 오지 마, 오지 마

translation.en: I'm coming up to you, Rob.
Doug, come on, mate, come on!
Rob, can you get yourself down?
Caro, we're not at that point, yet.
Rob, can you let us know who you're with?
Come on, Dougie, come on, mate. One more effort, come on.
translation.ko: 눈 떠, 더그 힘 좀 내봐

translation.en: Rob, what is Doug's state of consciousness?
He's really weak. He collapsed after we ran out of oxygen.
Okay, give him eight milligrams of dexamethasone.
Go ahead, Guy, I got you, mate.
Rob, I suggest you get yourself down.
You know you're doing no good up there.
Now, we've got people that we can send up to help Doug
but you've gotta get yourself down, do you understand?
I mean, come on, man, we're playing with a man's life here.
There's no way I'm leaving Doug behind.
No, we gotta keep moving, we're in some trouble.
Yeah, Helen's gonna need some help
so I'm gonna try and make my way back. Okay?
Send Anatoli back with some O.
No, I'm not leaving you behind, Doug.
No, Doug, come on, you're coming with me!
I need 10 good minutes, Doug, come on!
Ten minutes. We'll get to the bottom of the Step.
Hold that down. Come on, come on! Get those chairs!
No, no, no, no. Come on, Dougie!
translation.ko: 안 돼, 안 돼 어서, 더그!

translation.en: Doug! I'm gonna go to the South Summit to get oxygen.
translation.ko: 더그, 사우스 서밋에 가서 산소 가져올게

translation.en: Beck! Stop! That's the wrong way!
Here, I found some half-empty ones.
translation.ko: 여기 반쯤 남은 게 몇 통 있어!

translation.en: They're out there, I need help!
I go find them! You stay here!
Here, give me that, come on.
Why haven't I heard from you? Why hasn't anybody called me?
translation.ko: 왜 전화가 없어? 왜 다들 소식이 없지?

translation.en: They've been hit by a storm, Jan. It's really bad.
translation.ko: 폭풍이 불어, 잰 상황이 아주 나빠

translation.en: he was still on the summit at 4:00.
There's at least 13 people stranded up there
and, well, the storm is getting worse.
-Helen, do you understand? -Helen! Give me an update!
Jan, yeah, we will get him.
And I will call you the minute I hear from him.
As soon as I hear from him.
-Where is he? -Guy, I haven't heard from him.
Rob? It's Guy, where are you?
Guy, I've been doing that for the last two hours.
Once you catch a break, you move, you know the drill.
translation.ko: 기회가 될 때만 움직여 매뉴얼 알지?

translation.en: We've got a stash of oxygen on the South Col.
-Whoever needs it can have it. -That's the way, thank you.
Mal's team are gonna go up, they're gonna mount a search as soon as they can.
translation.ko: 멀의 팀이 최대한 빨리 수색 시작할 거야

translation.en: Anyone who's going, we're gonna leave at dawn, weather permitting.
translation.ko: 날씨가 허락하면 동틀 때 출발할 거야

translation.en: Of course, Helen. At dawn. That's great, David.
Go let Ed know what's going on, I'll be right behind you. Camp Four, come in.
translation.ko: - 에드한테 알려, 곧 갈게 - 제 4 캠프?

translation.en: Rob. Rob, can you hear me?
David Breashears has a stash of oxygen at the South Col that we can use.
translation.ko: 데이빗 브레쉬어가 사우스 콜에 산소를 남겨뒀대

translation.en: All right, mate, we're organizing a team, we're coming to get you.
translation.ko: 팀 짜서 곧 구하러 갈 거야

translation.en: Rob, talk to me, please. Pick up.
translation.ko: "5월 11일 토요일" 롭, 대답 좀 해, 제발…

translation.en: Is there any word on the others?
Anatoli managed to get three clients back from the South Col last night,
translation.ko: 아나톨리가 간밤에 셋을 사우스 콜에서 데려왔고

translation.en: but Beck and Yasuko are still out there.
They're trying to mount a search but everyone who's been up there is exhausted.
translation.ko: 수색팀을 보내려 해도 다들 이미 지쳐있어서…

translation.en: Rob, where are you? We're sending people for you.
Hey, mate. Yeah, I know. I know, mate. I know.
But you gotta keep on moving.
I can't feel my hands, they're frozen.
That's good. Yeah, you gotta get that mask working. Yeah?
The sun's gonna come up and, you know, you can get warmer, you can get moving.
translation.ko: 해가 떠서 따뜻해지면 움직일 수 있을 거야

translation.en: I'm gonna need a little help.
Okay, Rob, you gotta get yourself down. Where are you?
In that little dip just below the South Summit.
All right. You can do this.
You just gotta, you know, pull yourself up out of that dip
and slide the rest of the way.
I'm gonna need a little help.
We've got some Sherpas coming up there with tea, oxygen.
You just gotta come on down, mate.
Let's just try it. Let's just...
Put the sat phone next to the radio.
Yeah, if anyone can motivate him to move, then Jan will.
Guy to Rob. Can you read me?
Rob, I've got Jan for you.
Hi, sweetheart, how are you doing?
But the sun'll warm you soon.
We're sending people up to you with tea and O's.
translation.ko: 차와 산소를 갖고 사람들이 갈 거야

translation.en: But you've gotta get moving. Rob? Can you hear me?
translation.ko: 하지만 당신도 움직여야 돼 내 말 들려?

translation.en: You've gotta get your circulation going.
You do it... You do it right now.
It's gonna take all we got
Helen, it's Mike here. Do you copy?
Come in, Mike. What do you got?
did not make it back to camp.
Okay, Mike. Thanks for letting us know.
Helen Base Camp. Helen Base Camp.
translation.ko: 베이스 캠프의 헬렌 베이스 캠프의 헬렌

translation.en: There is a very bad storm again.
We'll try to again when the storm's passed.
We'll leave some tea and oxygen here. Sorry.
We have to tell Rob they're not coming.
The boys have hit a bit of high wind.
And your best shot is gonna be to get lower.
I think I can hang out here another night.
translation.ko: 하룻밤 더 버틸 수 있을 거 같아

translation.en: We'll try again first thing, okay?
He's just below the South Summit.
He's got oxygen, but it's iced up.
We don't know whether he's been able to free it.
You have to get him down before dark. He won't survive another night.
translation.ko: 밤 되기 전에 구해야 돼 내일까진 못 버텨

translation.en: But the storm's come back, real bad.
translation.ko: 근데 폭풍이 또 불어 강한 폭풍이…

translation.en: We can't get anyone up to him tonight.
He might as well be on the moon.
Can you put me on with him again?
Hold on. Give me a sec.
I might have a little frostbite.
I'm looking forward to making it all better.
I can't wait for you to come home.
Will you call her that for me?
I don't think I'm gonna get to meet her.
translation.ko: 난 새라를 못 만날 거 같아

translation.en: If anyone can make it, you can.
David Breashears and the IMAX team are gonna get him down to Camp One.
translation.ko: 데이빗과 아이맥스 팀이 제 1 캠프로 데리고 갈 거야

translation.en: We don't even know how, but he is alive.
we can't get him down the Icefall.
Okay, what do we need? We need a helicopter, right?
Yeah, but they can't take a helicopter up that high
because the air is too thin.
We should try, but it is one heck of a risk.
And he's not in a good way, Peach, so I don't want you to get your hopes up too high.
translation.ko: 그리고 건강도 나빠서… 너무 큰 기대는 마세요

translation.en: I know you are. Come on.
Yes, I'd like the number of the American Embassy in Kathmandu, Nepal.
No, you listen, sir, my husband's already died once as you'll have seen on the news.
translation.ko: 내 남편은 이미 한 번 죽었어요 곧 뉴스 보시겠지만…

translation.en: Trust me, having him die a second time is not gonna play well on CNN.
translation.ko: 두 번 죽게 놔두면 이 좀 시끄러울걸요?

translation.en: Look like you are, a little bit.
Rob's still up there right now.
And Doug? What's he up to?
I don't know, no one's ever tried to fly higher than Base Camp before,
translation.ko: 베이스 캠프 위로는 올라간 적 없지만

translation.en: they're gonna give it a go.
You find an LZ, just mark it out with whatever you can.
Okay, worth a try. Thanks, Guy.
Got a chopper coming in, we need to make an LZ.
We got a chopper coming in!
Clear everyone back to the tents!
Thanks. Keep it clear, keep this whole area clear.
You land here, we'll never get back up.
We can't get any more out. It's as light as we're gonna get it!
Come on! You can do it!
Come on, buddy. You're nearly there.
Yeah, it's just him, just one! There.
I'm going to lift the tail up, to fly us over the edge.
translation.ko: 꼬리 쪽을 들어 언덕을 넘은 뒤

translation.en: Fall a bit, until the blades catch on the air.
Come on, let's get you inside.
